alert.note: Alert for Big Horn (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 27 at 10:53AM MDT until June 29 at 12:00PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Wyoming... Bighorn River at Basin affecting Big Horn County. For the Bighorn River Basin...including Basin...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY THURSDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by recent rain has brought river levels above bankfull. * WHERE...Bighorn River at Basin. * WHEN...Until early Thursday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, Minor agricultural flooding begins upstream and downstream of Basin. At 9.5 feet, Bankfull stage. Minor agricultural flooding continues to expand upstream and downstream of Basin. At 10.0 feet, Moderate to major agricultural flooding intensifies and becomes more widespread upstream and downstream of Basin. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:15 AM MDT Tuesday, June 27, the stage was 9.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to decrease through the week, and is forecasted to reach 9.5 feet late Wednesday. - Action stage is 9.5 feet. - Flood stage is 10.5 feet. &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement.
